definitions: rope or chain used to tie an animal or object to restrict its movement
examples: The goat was kept on a long tether in the yard
He reached the end of his tether with patience

definitions: small brightly colored freshwater fish popular in home aquariums
examples: The neon tetras swam together in the aquarium
She added several tetras to her fish tank

definitions: set or group of four related things or people
examples: The chromosome pairs formed a tetrad during meiosis
The musical composition featured a tetrad of instruments

definitions: three-dimensional geometric shape with four triangular faces meeting at sharp points
examples: The pyramid was actually a tetrahedron with triangular sides
Students built a tetrahedron using straws and string

definitions: group of four related literary, dramatic, or musical works intended as a connected series
examples: Wagner composed a famous tetralogy of operas
The author planned a tetralogy of fantasy novels

definitions: cloth or fabric made by weaving, knitting, or felting fibers together
examples: The museum displayed ancient textiles from various cultures
The textile industry employs millions of workers worldwide

definitions: act of sending brief written messages between mobile phones or devices
examples: Texting while driving is dangerous and illegal
She prefers texting to making phone calls

definitions: physical feel or appearance of a surface or substance
examples: The velvet had a smooth, luxurious texture
The artist added texture to the painting with thick brushstrokes

definitions: Scottish feudal lord or nobleman who held land from the king
examples: The thane ruled over his lands with absolute authority
Macbeth was made Thane of Cawdor in Shakespeare's play

definitions: roof covering made of straw, reeds, or similar plant materials
examples: The cottage had a traditional thatch roof
Workers replaced the old thatch with fresh straw

definitions: person who builds or repairs roofs using straw or reed materials
examples: The thatcher worked carefully to waterproof the roof
Finding a skilled thatcher has become increasingly difficult

definitions: process of ice or snow becoming liquid as temperature rises
examples: The spring thaw flooded the riverside paths
After the thaw, the roads became muddy

definitions: gradual melting of frozen substances as they warm up
examples: The thawing of permafrost threatens Arctic communities
Proper thawing of frozen meat prevents bacterial growth

definitions: building where plays, films, or performances are presented to audiences
art of writing, producing, and performing plays for audiences
examples: The new theatre downtown seats over a thousand people
She bought tickets for the theatre on Saturday night
He studied theatre at university for four years
Modern theatre often challenges traditional storytelling conventions

definitions: professional stage play or dramatic performance presented to an audience
examples: The theatrical received standing ovations every night
Local theatricals help support community arts programs

definitions: quality of being excessively dramatic, showy, or artificial in manner or style
examples: His speech was full of unnecessary theatricality
The opera's theatricality captivated the audience completely

definitions: belief in the existence of a god or gods who created and govern the universe
examples: Theism contrasts with atheism and agnosticism
Many world religions are based on theism

definitions: system of government where priests or religious leaders rule in the name of a deity
examples: Ancient Egypt operated as a theocracy for centuries
The country transformed from a theocracy to a democracy

definitions: person who studies religious faith, practice, and experience systematically
examples: The theologian wrote extensively about biblical interpretation
Medieval theologians debated the nature of divine grace

definitions: mathematical statement that has been proven true through logical reasoning and accepted principles
examples: Students learned to prove the Pythagorean theorem
The theorem required several pages of mathematical proof

definitions: person who develops or studies theories rather than practical applications in a field
examples: The theoretician proposed a new model of particle physics
Economic theoreticians often disagree about market behavior

definitions: person who forms theories or speculates about a particular subject
examples: The conspiracy theorist made wild claims without evidence
Leading theorists in psychology gathered for the conference

definitions: treatment, medicine, or activity designed to cure disease or improve health and wellbeing
examples: Swimming provides excellent therapeutic benefits for joints
The doctor recommended several therapeutic options

definitions: electronic instrument played by moving hands near two antennas to control pitch and volume
examples: The theremin created eerie sounds for the horror movie
Learning to play the theremin requires precise hand control

definitions: column of rising warm air used by birds and gliders to gain altitude
examples: The eagle rode the thermal high into the sky
Glider pilots search for thermals to extend their flights

definitions: instrument used to measure temperature, typically containing mercury or alcohol in a sealed tube
examples: The thermometer showed a fever of 102 degrees
Digital thermometers have largely replaced mercury ones

definitions: device that automatically regulates temperature by switching heating or cooling systems on and off
examples: She adjusted the thermostat to save energy costs
The thermostat keeps the room at a constant temperature

definitions: actor or actress, especially one who performs in theatrical productions
examples: The veteran thespian received a lifetime achievement award
Young thespians auditioned for the school play

definitions: eighth letter of the Greek alphabet, often used in mathematics and science
examples: The angle was represented by theta in the equation
Theta waves occur during deep meditation states

definitions: ingredient or substance added to liquids to increase their viscosity or density
examples: Cornstarch serves as a thickening for the sauce
The recipe called for a thickening agent

definitions: dense group of bushes, shrubs, or small trees growing closely together
examples: The rabbit disappeared into the thorny thicket
They cut a path through the thicket

definitions: practice or act of stealing things from other people
examples: The neighborhood suffered from increasing thievery
Security cameras helped reduce thievery in stores

definitions: act or practice of taking things that belong to others without permission
examples: The thieving from local shops had become a problem
Birds engaged in thieving food from picnic tables

definitions: small cap worn on finger to protect it when pushing needle through fabric
examples: She wore a silver thimble while quilting
The antique thimble belonged to her grandmother

definitions: person who thinks deeply about important subjects or develops new ideas
examples: Great thinkers have shaped human understanding throughout history
The sculpture depicts a thinker in deep contemplation

definitions: liquid substance used to reduce the thickness or viscosity of paint
examples: He added paint thinner to make application easier
The thinner evaporated quickly in the heat

definitions: process of making something less dense or removing excess to improve growth
examples: Hair thinning becomes more common with age
Forest thinning helps prevent devastating wildfires

definitions: one of three equal parts of something divided
position number three in a sequence or ranking
examples: She inherited a third of her father's estate
The recipe calls for one third cup of sugar
He finished third in the race
March is the third month of the year

definitions: physical feeling of needing or wanting to drink something
examples: The marathon runner's thirst was overwhelming
Nothing satisfies thirst better than cold water

definitions: cardinal number equal to twelve plus one
examples: The building has thirteen floors in total
Many cultures consider thirteen an unlucky number

definitions: number thirteen in a sequence or order
examples: Friday the thirteenth is considered unlucky by some
The thirteenth amendment abolished slavery in America

definitions: number thirty in a sequence or order
examples: They celebrated their thirtieth wedding anniversary
November thirtieth marks the end of autumn

definitions: cardinal number equal to three times ten
examples: The meeting will last thirty minutes
She turned thirty years old last week
